pullRequest.body:
The embedding of `Type` into `Cat`, which views a set as a discrete category, is right adjoint to the functor `connectedComponents : Cat -> Set` which maps a category to its set of connected components.


---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [130fc79715](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15614/commits/130fc7971542876f8229a72dde12276ad40bd45d)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Category.Cat.Adjunction | 313 | 347 | +34 (+10.86%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Category.Cat.Adjunction`|34|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ConnectedComponents.functorToDiscrete`
`+ ConnectedComponents.liftFunctor`
`+ ConnectedComponents.typeToCatHomEquiv`
`+ connectedComponents`
`+ connectedComponentsTypeToCatAdj`
`+ eq_of_zag`
`+ eq_of_zigzag`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Without having looked closely at your PR, I would guess it's better to build on the existing API for [CategoryTheory.ConnectedComponents](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/ConnectedComponents.html) instead
oh yes !! I did not see this. closing this one for now then

I rewired this to use  `CategoryTheory.ConnectedComponents` and its `Zigzag`.

There is much about `Zigzag` already in the file `IsConnected.lean` and this add a bit more about them in another file.
I wonder if this is not wise to make a `zigzag.lean` from `IsConnected.lean` or put my stuff in the latter.

Feel free to remove the `awaiting-author`¬†label when the PR is ready for review. 

A few remarks:
- I feel like there are too many auxiliary definitions. In `Relation.lean`, you could remove `toCC`, `cc_eq_of_hom`, `ccfmap` and `liftedMk`. Then the definition of the connected components functor could look like this:
```lean
/-- The connected components functor -/
def connectedComponents.{v,u} : Cat.{v, u} ‚•§ Type u where
  obj C := ConnectedComponents C
  map F :=
    Quotient.lift (Quotient.mk zigzagSetoidC ‚àò F.obj)
      (fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ Quot.sound ‚àò zigzag_obj_of_zigzag F)
  map_id _ := funext fun x ‚Ü¶ (Quotient.exists_rep x).elim (fun _ h ‚Ü¶ by simp [‚Üê h]; rfl)
  map_comp _ _ := funext (fun x ‚Ü¶ (Quotient.exists_rep x).elim (fun _ h => by simp [‚Üê h]))
```
.
- You should read the [mathlib naming conventions](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html). For instance, only lemmas (i.e. terms of type `Prop`) have underscores in their names; `def`s use camel case. Your names should also be more descriptive, for instance `cc` could mean a lot of things, `fnToFctr` is a bit hard to read
it's all in one file now

Thanks!

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by dagurtomas.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10360540011/job/28679159626)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10360540011/job/28679159783)
Just some minor comments, this is almost ready to go.
Looks good, just two very minor things then it's good to go.
This is `zigzag_obj_of_zigzag`.
This lemma should be stated for discrete categories in general
This does not follow the naming conventions

```suggestion
  homEquiv C X := {
    toFun := fnToFctr
    invFun := fctrToFn
    left_inv := fun _ ‚Ü¶ funext fun x ‚Ü¶ by
      obtain ‚ü®x, h‚ü© := Quotient.exists_rep x
      rw [‚Üê h]
      rfl
    right_inv  := fun fctr ‚Ü¶
      Functor.hext (fun _ ‚Ü¶ rfl) (fun c d f ‚Ü¶
        have : Subsingleton (fctr.obj c ‚ü∂ fctr.obj d) := Discrete.instSubsingletonDiscreteHom _ _
        (Subsingleton.elim (fctr.map f) _).symm.heq) }
  unit := { app:= fun C ‚Ü¶ fnToFctr (ùüô _) }
  counit :=  {
      app := fun X ‚Ü¶ fctrToFn (ùüô typeToCat.obj X)
      naturality := fun _ _ _ ‚Ü¶ funext fun x ‚Ü¶ by
        obtain ‚ü®x, h‚ü© := Quotient.exists_rep x
        aesop_cat }
  homEquiv_unit := fun {C X h} ‚Ü¶ Functor.hext (fun _ ‚Ü¶ by rfl) (fun _ _ _ ‚Ü¶ by rfl)
  homEquiv_counit := fun {C X G} ‚Ü¶ by funext cc;obtain ‚ü®_,_‚ü© := Quotient.exists_rep cc; aesop_cat
```
your `have : Subsingleton (fctr.obj c ‚ü∂ fctr.obj d) := Discrete.instSubsingletonDiscreteHom _ _` is nice..

I didn't know you could do

```lean
 (Subsingleton.elim (fctr.map f) _).symm.heq
```

instead of 

```lean
(this.elim (fctr.map f) _).symm.heq)
```
This can be replaced by `Zigzag.setoid C`¬†everywhere it appears in the code, except in the definition of `ccfmap`¬†where it causes an error in the line below. I'm not sure why.

```suggestion
lemma eq_of_zigzag (X) {a b : Discrete X} (h : Zigzag a b) : a.as = b.as := by
  induction h with
  | refl => rfl
  | tail _ h eq  =>
    exact eq.trans (h.elim (fun ‚ü®f‚ü© ‚Ü¶ Discrete.eq_of_hom f) 
      (fun ‚ü®f‚ü© ‚Ü¶ (Discrete.eq_of_hom f).symm))
```

I always try to make variable names consistent throughout the file. I changed the proof in the `tail`¬†case slightly, to me this is more readable. Maybe it's worth proving a lemma `eq_of_zag`¬†as well, and apply that in the inductive proof.

This shouldn't be a private def, it should look something like this and be in a different file:

```lean
@[simps]
def ConnectedComponents.functorToDiscrete {X C : Type*} [Category C] (f : ConnectedComponents C ‚Üí X) : 
    C ‚•§ Discrete X where
  obj :=  Discrete.mk ‚àò f ‚àò Quotient.mk (Zigzag.setoid _)
  map :=  Discrete.eqToHom ‚àò congrArg f ‚àò Quotient.sound ‚àò Zigzag.of_hom
```

In particular, it shouldn't mention `Cat`¬†or the functors `connectedComponents`¬†and `typeToCat`.
makes sense

Similarly to above, this belongs in a different file and shouldn't mention `Cat`, `connectedComponents`¬†or `typeToCat`. Something like

```lean
def foo {X C : Type*} [Category C] (F : C ‚•§ Discrete X) : 
    (ConnectedComponents C ‚Üí X) :=
  Quotient.lift
    (fun c => (F.obj c).as)
    (fun _ _ h => eq_of_zigzag X (zigzag_obj_of_zigzag F h))
```

(with a proper name, of course). Then, you can define a more general `Equiv` which will then be then applied in the `homEquiv`¬†field of the adjunction below.

```suggestion
  homEquiv_counit := fun {C X G} => by funext cc;obtain ‚ü®_,_‚ü© := Quotient.exists_rep cc; aesop_cat
```
You should implement this suggestion, automation takes care of the field `homEquiv_unit`¬†so it can be safely removed.
The universe `v`¬†should be declared at the top of the file and should not appear in the name of this declaration.
This should be stated without reference to `Cat`, similarly to its `toFun`¬†and `invFun`.
Could you prove the analogous lemma for `Zag`¬†and use that in the proof of this?

- I don't think `C`¬†and `X` need to be in the same universe. You can use `Type*`¬†and drop the universe annotation on the `Category`¬†instance.
- The name doesn't really make sense. Maybe `ConnectedComponents.functorToDiscrete`?

```suggestion
    (f : ConnectedComponents C ‚Üí X) : C ‚•§ Discrete X where
  obj Y :=  Discrete.mk (f (Quotient.mk (Zigzag.setoid _) Y))
  map g := Discrete.eqToHom (congrArg f (Quotient.sound (Zigzag.of_hom g)))
```
- You generally see a lot more unicode arrows in mathlib instead of `->`, but I don't know if this is a strict rule.
- I think it's a bit clearer to see what a functor does to objects/morphisms if you use my suggested notation instead of `‚àò`.

- Again, the name doesn't really make sense, something like `ConnectedComponents.discreteFunctorLift`¬†would be better.
- `F`¬†would be a better variable name than `fctr` for a functor. 
- The variable `C`¬†and the category instance are already in scope, so you don't need to declare them again. In fact, `C` is never used throughout the file, so you might as well remove the variable line defining `C` and use `J` instead for the category, which is consistent with the rest of the file.
so if the previous one was `functorToDiscrete`, as per the result type, this one should probably be `functionFromConnectedComponents`  ?

Well, `functionFromConnected` could mean any function from the connected components. I think `discreteFunctorLift`¬†(or something including `functor`¬†and¬†`lift`) is more descriptive because you're lifting a functor to a function on the connected components
What about `toFunctorToDiscrete` and `fromFunctorToDiscrete` ?

The following pairs would be consistent 

or `fromFunctionFromConnectedComponents` and `fromFunctorToDiscrete`

or `toFunctorToDiscrete` and `fromFunctorToDiscrete`

or `fromFunctionFromConnectedComponents  and `toFunctionFromConnectedComponents`

or `toFunctorToDiscrete ` and `toFunctionFromConnectedComponents `
This should be moved to the same file as its `toFun`¬†and `invFun`

```suggestion
def ConnectedComponents.liftFunctor  {X : Type*} (F : J ‚•§ Discrete X) :
```
`ConnectedComponents`¬†is already part of the name (in the namespace).

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  | tail _ h eq  => exact eq.trans (eq_of_zag _ h)
```

```suggestion
/-- The connected components functor -/
def connectedComponents : Cat.{v, u} ‚•§ Type u where
```
There are two extra blank lines here that you need to remove (I think that was my suggestion which is marked as resolved here)

```suggestion
def ConnectedComponents.liftFunctor {X : Type*} (F :J ‚•§ Discrete X) :
    (ConnectedComponents J ‚Üí X) :=
  Quotient.lift (fun c => (F.obj c).as)
    (fun _ _ h => eq_of_zigzag X (zigzag_obj_of_zigzag F h))

/-- Functions from connected components and functors to discrete category are in bijection -/
def ConnectedComponents.typeToCatHomEquiv  (J) [Category J] (X : Type*) :
    (ConnectedComponents J ‚Üí X) ‚âÉ (J ‚•§ Discrete X)   where
```
Also, I think you want `J`¬†to be explicit here?

how do you see that ?
It might make sense to be explicit elsewhere too
Because there is no way to infer it from other variables
Or maybe implicit in what we have, explicit in what we need

> It might make sense to be explicit elsewhere too

Not in the toFun and invFun, because there it can be inferred from the argument

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Adjunction): `typeToCat` is right adjoint to `connectedComponents` functor
